articles.title: Apple Intelligence Products Could Make Up For Apple’s (AAPL) iPhone Weakness
articles.content: As smartphone companies fight to be the first to launch the latest generative AI features in their iPhones, Apple is taking its time. The company is facing weak iPhone sales and seems to be behind in the AI race. But all that could change once the first Apple Intelligence device hits the market. Apple Inc. […]

articles.title: Big Pension Sold Palantir, Apple, and Nvidia Stock. It Bought AMD.
articles.content: Big Pension Sold Palantir, Apple, and Nvidia Stock. It Bought AMD.

articles.title: Pixelmator announces agreement to be acquired by Apple
articles.content: Pixelmator said in a blog post: “Today we have some important news to share: the Pixelmator Team plans to join Apple (AAPL). We’ve been inspired by Apple since day one, crafting our products with the same razor-sharp focus on design, ease of use, and performance. And looking back, it’s crazy what a small group of dedicated people have been able to achieve over the years from all the way in Vilnius, Lithuania. Now, we’ll have the ability to reach an even wider audience and make an even bigger imp

articles.title: Berkshire Hathaway’s Cash Pile Reaches Record $325.2 Billion
articles.content: (Bloomberg) -- Berkshire Hathaway Inc.’s cash pile reached $325.2 billion in the third quarter, a record for the conglomerate, as Warren Buffett continued to refrain from major acquisitions while trimming some of his most significant equity stakes.Most Read from BloombergIstanbul Tries Free Public Transit to Help Job SeekersIs Denver’s Big Bet on E-Bikes Paying Off?The Answer To Making Cities More Family-Friendly? articles.title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Sells Apple Stock, Boosts Cash Pile to Record
articles.content: Berkshire Hathaway on Saturday reported its profit fell in the third quarter while its cash pile swelled to a record as it trimmed its stakes in Apple and Bank of America.

articles.title: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway Slashes Apple Stake Again
articles.content: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway  sold more  Apple  stock in the third quarter.  Apple has been a major bet for Berkshire, and one that paid off big time as tech-hungry investors drove the stock ever higher in recent years.  This year, Berkshire has slashed the position, though Buffett has continued to praise the company.

articles.title: Berkshire Sold 25% of Its Apple Stock in the Third Quarter
articles.content: The 25% reduction in its stake follows a nearly 50% cut in the second quarter.  Berkshire’s overall Apple stake is now down by about two thirds—from 905 million shares—since the start of the year.  Barron’s calculation of the Sept. 30 Apple stake is based on information in Berkshire’s third-quarter 10-Q, which was released in conjunction with the company’s earnings report on Saturday morning.

articles.title: Morgan Stanley says Globalstar expanded Apple relationship ‘very encouraging’
articles.content: After Globalstar (GSAT) filed an 8K disclosing an expanded relationship with Apple (AAPL), Morgan Stanley analyst Simon Flannery noted that details are still limited, but says the new expanded relationship with Apple “appears to be very encouraging.” While the firm awaits more details around the nature, cost and deployment timeline for the new constellation, which it understands will be in addition to the 17 satellites currently under construction to be launched next year, it keeps an Equal Weig

articles.title: Apple debate ‘little changed’ after Q4 report, says Morgan Stanley
articles.content: Morgan Stanley analyst Erik Woodring argues that Apple’s (AAPL) September-end quarter results and “mixed” December quarter guidance “provided something for bulls and bears, leaving the “debate little changed.” While the firm believes shares are likely to be range-bound in the near-term, it believes downside is limited and wants to be “early to the iPhone 17 party,” the analyst tells investors. The firm maintains an Overweight rating and $273 price target on Apple shares. Published first on TheFl

articles.title: When Facebook became Meta, Big Tech's AI spending spree, and Elon Musk's robots: Tech news roundup
articles.content: Tesla (TSLA) CEO Elon Musk said on Tuesday that he thinks humanoid robots will outnumber humans in less than 20 years. His company is helping to make that future a possibility.
